gameDetails.venue: Intuit Dome, Los Angeles, CA (Neutral Site)

recentPerformance.hitRate: Arizona 3-0 start with veteran-heavy roster producing in big games
recentPerformance.seasonAverage: Wildcats averaging 78.2 PPG with balanced scoring from guards
recentPerformance.recentForm: Won all 3 games including quality win over previously undefeated opponent
recentPerformance.cushion: Line moved from +5 to +6.5 on sharp Arizona money - market signal

keyFactors.title: Sharp Money on Arizona
keyFactors.description: Line moved from +5 to +6.5 in Arizona's favor despite UConn being back-to-back champion. Sharp bettors moved line 1.5 points toward Arizona - significant market signal. When smart money identifies value, follow it.

keyFactors.title: Arizona's Veteran Core
keyFactors.description: Henri Dell'Orso and Caleb Love provide experienced guard play that performs in pressure situations. Seniors handle big games better than underclassmen. Arizona's veteran leadership will shine on neutral court against UConn's talented but less experienced roster.

keyFactors.title: Neutral Site Negates UConn Advantage
keyFactors.description: Playing at Intuit Dome in LA eliminates Gampel Pavilion home court edge. Neutral site games favor experienced teams with composure. Arizona's veteran guards thrive without hostile crowd affecting decision-making.

keyFactors.title: UConn's Early Season Struggles
keyFactors.description: Defending champions 2-1 but winning by smaller margins than expected. Lost key pieces from championship runs. Still gelling as unit early in season. Arizona can capitalize on UConn's adjustment period.

keyFactors.title: Arizona's Defensive Identity
keyFactors.description: Wildcats forcing 16.3 turnovers per game with aggressive pressure defense. UConn's ball handlers will face constant pressure. Arizona's half-court defense ranks top-50 nationally in efficiency.

riskFactors: UConn has championship pedigree and can elevate in big games
Dan Hurley's coaching adjustments could neutralize Arizona's strengths
Wildcats could be intimidated by defending champion aura
Early season games have high variance - rosters still developing

henriDellOrso.note: Led Arizona with 20 points including clutch baskets in final 5 minutes

calebLove.note: 11 points in final 5:17 including go-ahead three, veteran closing

tobiePugh.note: Physical presence on boards helped Arizona control glass 35-28

alexKaraban.note: Led UConn but couldn't get help from teammates in crunch time

solosBall.note: 14 points but 0 in final 6 minutes as Arizona defense clamped

quarterBreakdown.description: Back-and-forth opening half with UConn holding slim 3-point lead. Karaban led all scorers with 12 first-half points. Arizona stayed within striking distance despite early 8-point deficit (22-14 at 8:42). Dell'Orso kept Wildcats close with 11 first-half points. Both teams shooting under 43% - defensive battle.

Arizona took control with 12-4 run to start second half. Love hit two consecutive threes to give Wildcats first lead since 4-2. Pugh's offensive rebounding (4 in span) gave Arizona extra possessions. UConn's offense stagnated with 5 turnovers in first 10 minutes of half. Arizona lead 52-52 with 10:00 left.

Arizona closed on 15-4 run over final 7:17. Love hit go-ahead three (63-60) with 5:17 left, never trailed again. Dell'Orso scored 9 points in final 5 minutes on clutch mid-range jumpers. UConn went 2-11 FG in final 8 minutes as Arizona defense suffocated. Final: Arizona 71, UConn 67 - outright win.

gameResults.whenCleared: Covered +6.5 when Dell'Orso hit mid-range jumper with 2:08 remaining to extend lead to 69-63. UConn could only cut deficit to 4 points (final 71-67). Arizona won outright as underdog, covering spread by 10.5 points.
gameResults.turningPoint: Love's go-ahead three-pointer with 5:17 remaining (63-60 Arizona lead) swung momentum permanently. UConn never led again. Arizona's 15-4 closing run epitomized veteran composure - Dell'Orso and Love combined for 20 of Arizona's final 26 points. UConn's young roster couldn't respond to veteran closing.
gameResults.gamePace: Arizona controlled pace with deliberate half-court offense. Wildcats slowed game to limit UConn's transition opportunities. Arizona's 12 turnovers vs UConn's 17 gave possessions edge. Defensive intensity increased in second half - UConn shot 37.5% after halftime.
gameResults.teamOffense: Arizona's balanced attack with three 14+ scorers (Dell'Orso 20, Love 18, Pugh 14) created matchup problems. UConn focused on Love but Dell'Orso's mid-range game opened up. 35-28 rebounding edge (+7) provided extra possessions for patient offense.

whatWentRight.title: Veteran Closing
whatWentRight.description: Dell'Orso (20 pts) and Love (18 pts) combined for 20 of Arizona's final 26 points. Seniors took over in crunch time exactly as predicted. Love's go-ahead three and Dell'Orso's clutch mid-range jumpers epitomized experienced guards performing under pressure.

whatWentRight.title: Sharp Money Validated
whatWentRight.description: Line moved from +5 to +6.5 on sharp Arizona money - and Arizona won outright by 4. Sharp bettors identified value that books missed. Following sharp action produced winner as Wildcats covered by 10.5 points.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Second Half
whatWentRight.description: Arizona held UConn to 37.5% shooting in second half (15-40). Huskies went 2-11 FG in final 8 minutes. Wildcats' pressure defense forced 5 second-half turnovers. Championship-caliber defense when it mattered most.

whatWentRight.title: Rebounding Dominance
whatWentRight.description: Arizona's 35-28 rebounding edge (+7) controlled game. Pugh's 8 rebounds anchored frontcourt. Second-chance points (8-4) gave extra possessions to patient offense. Physical interior play overwhelmed UConn.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Dell'Orso's 20 points above his 15.3 PPG average - stepped up in biggest game. Arizona's 71 points below 78.2 average but defensive game against elite opponent acceptable.
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Love's 11 fourth-quarter points matched his clutch reputation. Arizona's closing ability (15-4 run) ranked 95th percentile for late-game execution.
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Won outright as +6.5 underdog. Covered by 10.5 points. Never trailed in final 5:17. Complete domination of closing minutes.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Arizona's 2-11 UConn FG in final 8 minutes ranked 98th percentile defensively. Love's go-ahead three and Dell'Orso's 9 final-5-min points ranked 90th percentile for clutch performances.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No. This was veteran composure beating less-experienced opponent in neutral site game. Sharp money moved line 1.5 points toward Arizona for reason - they identified matchup advantage. Dell'Orso and Love's combined 38 points with clutch closing (20 of final 26) validated veteran edge thesis. UConn's 2-11 FG down stretch wasn't luck - it was Arizona's elite defense suffocating young Huskies. Process-driven win from identifying sharp line movement and veteran advantage.

closingLineValue.verdict: Marginal positive CLV. Captured Arizona +6.5 at -108 before closing at -110. Small juice savings but more importantly, sharp money was right - Arizona won outright by 4. Following sharp action that moved line 1.5 points was correct process. Outcome (outright win) exceeded expectations.

keyTakeaways: Sharp money moved line from +5 to +6.5 on Arizona - always follow significant line movements in your direction
Veteran guards (Dell'Orso 20, Love 18) dominate in neutral site big games - combined for 20 of final 26 points
Arizona won outright as +6.5 underdog, covering by 10.5 points - maximum value from identified edge
UConn's 2-11 FG in final 8 minutes validates Arizona's defensive prowess under pressure
Rebounding edge (+7) controls games - Arizona's 35-28 advantage gave extra possessions
Love's go-ahead three (5:17 left) and Dell'Orso's 9 final-5-min points epitomize clutch veteran performances
Neutral site negated UConn home advantage - experienced teams thrive without crowd factors
Early season championship teams still finding identity - capitalize on adjustment periods
1u stake appropriate for NCAAB given variance but sharp line movement demanded action
For quantitative operations: trust sharp money line movements of 1.5+ points, hit rate exceeds 60%
verdict: Perfect execution following sharp money and veteran edge thesis. Every pre-game indicator materialized: line moved from +5 to +6.5 on sharp Arizona money (validated by outright win), veteran guards Dell'Orso and Love combined for 38 points with 20 of final 26 (clutch closing), Arizona's defense held UConn to 2-11 FG in final 8 minutes (suffocating pressure), rebounding dominance (+7) controlled game. Won outright by 4 as +6.5 underdog - covered by 10.5 points. This represents textbook sharp money follow with veteran advantage on neutral court. Would make this bet 100 times - sharp bettors moved line for reason. Trust the market signals.
